definitions.definition: To amuse (someone); to engage the attention of agreeably.
definitions.example: The motivational speaker not only instructed but also entertained the audience.

definitions.definition: To have someone over at one's home for a party or visit.
To receive and take into consideration; to have a thought in mind.
definitions.example: The committee would like to entertain the idea of reducing the budget figures.

definitions.definition: To take or keep in one's service; to maintain; to support; to harbour; to keep.
To meet or encounter, as an enemy.
To lead on; to bring along; to introduce.
